definitions: To happen or take place as planned or expected; to succeed.
To become detached or separated from something.
To appear or seem in a particular way; to be perceived as having a particular quality or character.
To perform in a particular way, especially in a competition or performance.
To stop taking a drug or medication.
examples: The party came off without a hitch.
The handle came off the cup.
He comes off as very arrogant.
The team came off well in the first half.
She came off the medication last week.
